description: Self-inverse permutation: reverse the bits in binary expansion of n and also complement them (0->1, 1->0) if the run count (A005811) is even.
links: Paul Tek, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8191
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
maple: [seq(runcounts2binexp(reverse(binexp2runcounts(j))),j=0..511)];runcounts2binexp := proc(c) local i,e,n; n := 0; for i from 1 to nops(c) do e := c[i]; n := ((2^e)*n) + ((i mod 2)*((2^e)-1)); od; RETURN(n); end;binexp2runcounts := proc(nn) local n,a,p,c; n := nn; a := []; p := (`mod`(n,2)); c := 0; while(n > 0) do c := c+1; n := floor(n/2); if((`mod`(n,2)) <> p) then a := [c,op(a)]; c := 0; p := (`mod`(p+1,2)); fi; od; RETURN(a); end;# reverse given in A056538
crossrefs: When restricted to A014486 induces another permutation, A057164. A105726 is a "deep" variant.
author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 20, 2000
